225000. Masovia becomes Poland

Masovia — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Krakow
  • Control Krakow
  • Own Kalisz
  • Own Poznan
  • The following must not occur:
    • Poland exists

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1419
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

We have united main polish lands under our rule. Shall we revive that old Kingdom of Poland?

Actions

A. We shall become Poland

  • Flag graphics set to default
  • Become Poland
  • Move capital to Krakow
  • Podlasie will be considered a claim province
  • Rus Halicka will be considered a claim province
  • Podkarpacie will be considered a claim province
  • Lublin will be considered a claim province
  • Sandomierz will be considered a claim province
  • Krakow will be considered a national province
  • Bydgoszcz will be considered a claim province
  • Poznan will be considered a claim province
  • Kalisz will be considered a claim province
  • Dobrzyn will be considered a claim province
  • Torun will be considered a claim province
  • Pomerelia will be considered a claim province
  • Warmia will be considered a claim province
  • ruthenian will become an accepted culture
  • +50 victory points

B. No, we have other things to do

  • Stability +1

Back to top

225001. Polish crown inherits Masovian duchies

Masovia — Not random

Conditions

  • Poland exists

Will happen within 360 days of January 2, 1462
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after February 2, 1500)

Description

In late XV century Masovia consisted of many duchies ruled by Masovian Piasts, however with the time some of Masovian Piast were dying without leaving male heritage. Polish crown used these opportunities to inherit such duchies. In 1462 Poland inherited Gostynin, Rawa and Belz and in 1492 entire Plock duchy.

Actions

A. We have to be more cautious about policy of Poland

  • Stability -1
  • Cede Belz to Poland
  • Cede Plock to Poland
  • Belz will no longer be considered a national province
  • Plock will no longer be considered a national province
  • -15 relations with Poland
  • -30
  • Event 258016 - Polish crown inherits Masovian duchies for Poland is triggered immediately

Back to top

225002. Prince Janusz II and the Teutonic Order

Masovia — Not random

Conditions

  • Teutonic Order exists

Will happen within 360 days of January 2, 1489
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after February 2, 1500)

Description

In late XV century Masovia was facing threats of being incorporated to Poland, despite of this Janusz II, the prince of Ciechanow and Plock duchies in Mazovia was very active in politics. One of results of his policy was normalizing and improving relations with the Teutonic Order. In 1489 as only Polish he was invited by the Teutonic Order Grandmaster, Johann von Tieffen to become member of the Order.

Actions

A. Accept the offer

  • Stability -1
  • +10 victory points
  • +50 relations with Teutonic Order
  • -30 relations with Poland

B. Refuse

  • -30 relations with Teutonic Order
  • +30 relations with Poland

Back to top

20141. The end of Piast dynasty on Masovia

Masovia — Not random

Conditions

  • Relations with Poland are at 0 or higher
  • Poland exists

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1525
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1596)

Description

The last princes of the Masovian line of the Piast dynasty lived short lives and were more interested in trivial distractions than in governing their state. When Janusz IV died in 1526, few cried, and Poland had no problems with incorporating their once-owned province back into the Crown.

Actions

A. We accept

  • Event 20142 - The Polish Inheritance of Masovia for Poland is triggered immediately

B. Refuse polish demands

  • Event 20142 - The Polish Inheritance of Masovia for Poland will never fire
  • Event 20143 - The Polish Claims on Masovia for Poland is triggered immediately
  • Aristocracy +1
  • Stability +3
  • -100 relations with Poland
